website_summaries.verdict: Boasting realistic details, an adaptable design, and a rugged construction, this ride-on toy grows with your child, offering years of cruising fun.
pros: Detailed design features battery powered lights, a working horn, 2 doors, and a large trunk so kids can take their favorite toys and snacks along for the ride
Removable floor board and push handle allows it to convert from a parent push car to kid-powered cruiser as little ones grow
cons: Some owners feel assembly should be easier

website_summaries.verdict: A high-end ride on with nifty features and realistic details. If you're looking for a rugged ride-on that will grow with your toddler, this is a great option.
pros: Features realistic details, including a Ford branded grill, working headlights, a horn with sound, turning steering wheel, and 2 doors
Trunk and cup holders are nice touches
Removable push handle and a 5th wheel makes parent-powered strolls a breeze
Roomy interior and good maximum weight capacity combined with a removable floorboard gives kids plenty of room to grow
cons: Assembly can be tricky and time-consuming

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kid, pain for those who have to put it together
customer_reviews.text: The truck is decently cute once completed. But it is annoyingly painful to put together. The holes for the axels and handle were too small and required applying some force or drilling. Few other things fit poorly as well including doors which do not close properly due to the gaps between them and the rest of the truck body. Also, somebody should have put some thought into how to replace dead batteries as nobody wants to disassemble this whole thing just for that. Basic seat belt would have been very useful. 0 stars for the quality, the rest is all for the joy it gave to my little guy.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly difficult to assemble. Some mistakes in assembly do not seem fixable
customer_reviews.text: I had to use a blow dryer to heat up the plastic because the holes are not well done. I was unable to install the 5th wheel given that I could not get the locking device to fit... in trying to losen it, it the top lock got stuck and now it is impossible to incorporate the fifth wheel. Total disaster. Without it, turns are pretty difficult. I did not realize my son had taken the tire disk out when I assembled it and it is basically impossible to disassemble to fix it (without damaging it). That being said, it is a cute jeep and my kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Paganini955

customer_reviews.title: Coolest kid on the block
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my truck/wheels obsessed son for his first birthday. He LOVES it. It was kind of confusing to put together, but do-able with some patience. It makes going for walks so much more fun for him and me! The only thing I would suggest is adding some type of seatbelt option. (I understand most people probably wouldn't purchase this for their one year old- so I assume older children don't slide down into the floorboard part of the truck.. so a safety strap may not be needed by everyone) I also wish there was an option to purchase different tires instead of the plastic ones, but so far they have been holding up well!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cheap do it yourself kit, not worth it. Go for little tikes.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the most frustrating thing I have had to put together in my 1 year as a dad. It is painful. Nothing is easy with this build and the overall quality is pretty poor. The pictures do way more justice than it deserves. No pre defined screwholes or anything, its cheap manufactured junk and I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrad

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: I had to write a review on this. My son loves it. I can't get him out. Lol. It is a bit tough to put together ... hard plastic, some hamerring and screwing involved, but totally worth it. Instructions were excellent. I took my time and put it together in like 2 hours broken up in 2 sessions. If i had some help other than my 18 month old , it would have been done much quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Vidya

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY unless you have serious mechanical skills to put this toy together.
customer_reviews.text: WAY over-complicated assembly. I've taken apart car engines - so needless to say i know a thing or two about putting stuff together yet i don't think i've ever cursed so much as while putting together this toy. I was on the verge of sending this car back only so the company hiring those brainless designers wouldn't get my money. STAY AWAY unless you have serious mechanical skills to put this toy together.
customer_reviews.author: Erinnisse Heuer

customer_reviews.title: ... and six year old daughter and ALL the kids love this!
customer_reviews.text: I run a daycare and have a two year old son and six year old daughter and ALL the kids love this!!! We go for walks in the neighborhood at night and will use the front lights so that oncoming traffic can see that something is there. I love that the floor board is removable because the kids will play in it throughout the house and then I just add the floorboard when we go on walks.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Northam

customer_reviews.title: The center front wheel is genius. I just wish it had a seat belt.
customer_reviews.text: Center turning wheel makes this so easy to push! Genius. I just wish it had a seat belt to keep my little guy seated. We only use it on concrete. I’ve pushed it in the grass and it’s hard to do so, but it’s not impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Walelia

customer_reviews.title: 20 month old enjoys riding in this toy truck
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are easy to follow and I had to issues putting it together. It took me about an hour at a leisurely pace with the trickiest part putting the stickers on just right. More a case of my OCD than anything :)
customer_reviews.author: DMc

customer_reviews.title: Engineering degree and muscles of John Cena needed to assemble
customer_reviews.text: My son lives this truck. I do not.it took me 2 hours to put together (don't judge I had both kids in my biz the whole time) and the directions and pictures were blurry, the holes weren't drilled large enough, requiring muscle and needle nosed plyers to make larger, plus the complexity of assembly was bananas! It would be a lot more palatable of Step 2 put at least a little bit together for us! Every single screw, nut and bolt needs to be assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel M.

customer_reviews.title: No seatbelt disaster
customer_reviews.text: Very cute truck and my son loves it! Only problem is there is no seat belt and the first walk with it he stood up and busted his mouth on the front windshield area! Blood was everywhere and very scary! Step2 should really add a seatbelt!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Decided to return
customer_reviews.text: I would give this zero stars if I could! I’ve got pretty good at putting together kids toys but this was the worst by far I’ve experienced yet. It had no pre drilled holes for the axel and trying to make the holes was just too much work for a me right now, especially after seeing people online saying it was junk once they had put it together so I decided to put it back in the box and return it.
customer_reviews.author: MartinaP

customer_reviews.title: Beast Hugs
customer_reviews.text: Hugs for days.. that's what this truck will get you. I thought the large doors were a negative until I saw him in it. Slightly too young he stands mostly. Now I'm happy for how tall the cabin space is on this truck
customer_reviews.author: Marc Pattins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...but no seatbelt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it looks so cool! I was worried about the reviews regarding the handle breaking. We have had it now about a month and it seems durable. However my mind is boggled as to why there is no seatbelt.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great for One year old
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this did not give a 5 stars is because it is difficult putting together. A lot of the holes did NOT line up correctly but once together, its very nice. Wish it had straps to keep my one year old from standing though
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Shubert

customer_reviews.title: Front wheel assembly was difficult to but together and is ...
customer_reviews.text: Front wheel assembly was difficult to but together and is not very beefy (note the little one in the center, the two wheels are just decoration. First issue is you think you will destroy it in assembly, a hammer is the tool required. Now, it was purchased for my 1 year old, however I am convinced the 3 and 7 year old will destroy it somehow. So far it works and my son loves it, just hope the front wheel lasts for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Directions horrible but product is great!!
customer_reviews.text: This would be 5 star if directions were good. Read lots of reviews where people had issues with the directions but I am very handy and had to call the company. They said it would be difficult to change the directions in 8 languages. Really? In the days of computers. The product is worth the buy the company is better than their directions!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: pamela williams

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves it!!!! The size is roomy and it is easy to push and control. It was a great purchase for his 3rd Birthday.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: EASY TO PUT TOGETHER. GRAND KIDS LOVE IT AND SO DID I. WONDERFUL WALKS. I WOULD BUY AGAIN. NOT A BAD PRICE.

customer_reviews.title: Fun truck for small child
customer_reviews.text: Love this item! It took a while to assemble and the stickers aren’t super durable but my 1 year old son’s face lights up every time he gets to ride in it!

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: This truck is a hit with our grandchildren (ages 1 and 2). I know they'll both enjoy it for years. It is well made and the options are great! I take my 1 year old grandson for walks with it and he loves opening and closing the door as well as climbing in and out of it.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My grandbaby loves it! Great safety locks on doors! Fun 4 walks!

customer_reviews.title: The assembly of this item is horrendous.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 1 year old and when it arrived at our doorstep I decided to assemble it the following morning. The reason why I gave this item 2 starts is mostly due to the assembly. The holes were undersized and if I didn't own a power drill it would have been impossible to put this together using the recommended tools listed on the instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: JStylez

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't what I expected as I thought it was battery operated. Was somewhat easy to put together as some of the screws had to forced in as the holes were a little small. All in all, my grand son loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronne42

customer_reviews.title: What a cool push truck!
customer_reviews.text: What a cool push truck, my granddaughter and her daddy, a Raptor owner, love the truck. It took a little time to put together but totally worth the effort!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a big truck! Buyer beware that we ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a big truck! Buyer beware that we had to use a drill for the posts on the wheels when the instructions claimed they would slide right in! Holes were no where close to being big enough. Took about 2 hours to put together. My son loves it and that's all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Bigliazzi

customer_reviews.title: I have two kids. My youngest sits in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two kids. My youngest sits in the front, and my son sits in the "back." It's not another seat, it's more of a trunk. But we stuff a pillow in there, and he sits on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Heyman

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun! My 18 month old loves this truck
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun! My 18 month old loves this truck. Two cons: - no seatbelt, although there are holes for you to fashion your own - the back handle is a little wobbly, and could be sturdier Otherwise, great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Meh

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this truck! All the features such ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this truck! All the features such as the area in the back of the truck which holds drinks or toys, the removable floorboard, the pivot wheel in front, and the parent handle make this truck enjoyable for the adult pushing it and the child riding.

customer_reviews.text: It was given to my grandson for his 1st birthday. He loves riding in it. My husband found it a bit challenging to put together but said it was worth it.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TRUCK

customer_reviews.title: Great toy. Worth the money in smiles alone
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. Worth the money in smiles alone. My daughter loves it. I build real cars for a living and the assembly was more complicated than expected. Not difficult but involved. Only thing I would add is a seat belt.

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice truck but we have it about 5 months and ...

It should be made strongly since little kids using it... without the wheel it is not the same.. that is the main part of it, kind of..My son loves to beep while driving it so it is very dissapointing.

customer_reviews.text: One year old grandson enjoys his big ride and what a back saver! Construction is durable. He likes opening and closing the doors, putting things in and taking them out. Will grow with him.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome car: my little one doesn't want to get ...

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase Ever
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this truck so much it has motivated us to take daily walks !! He rides in it for a 1.1 mile walk and loves it the entire time !! It also doubles as a “wagon” for us such a great purchase!! If your questioning purchasing Don’t, seriously buy it !!!!

He can't quite use it on his own yet (he is 17 months old) but he loves being pushed in it. And he loves just sitting it to watch his movies!! It's his own little drive-in!

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for the little 2 year old I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for the little 2 year old I bought it for. She was fascinated with all the working parts...lights, horn, etc. Fairly easy to put together and sturdy. Would definitely recommend this product! Is providing tons of fun!

customer_reviews.title: My son absolutely adores his truck. It's kind of ...
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely adores his truck. It's kind of a pain to assemble, but completely worth it. My only complaint is that it doesn't come with a seat belt so my kiddo can stand up or turn around whenever he wants. Other than that, our whole family loves it!!

product_meta.title: Step2 2-in-1 Ford F-150 SVT Raptor Parent Push Car
product_meta.description: 2-in-1 Ford F-150 SVT Raptor by Step2 grows with your little truck driver! From push buggy to a kid powered riding toy, the durable 2-in-1 Ford F-150 SVT Raptor will be the coolest truck on the sidewalk. This ride-on truck is packed with fun, realistic features for pretend play. Working lights, rugged tires, two working doors, steering wheel and large trunk are just a few of the features that your child will love. The recommended age for the 2-in-1 Ford F-150 SVT Raptor is 1.5 and up. Adult assembly and three “AA” batteries (not included) are required. The product dimensions without the handle are 22” H x 20.5” W x 38” D and with handle are 39.25” H x 20.5” W x 50.5” D.
feature_bullets: Realistic looking Ford Raptor ride on toy with working lights in the front grille
Tough rugged wheels with 360 degree turning and two working doors with latches
Easily converts from a parent push car to a foot to floor ride on with removable floor board and removable push handle
Truck bed used for storage of little treasures or snacks
Realistic steering wheel with an actual honking horn

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars371 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
